messages.message:
Hi there,

I'm a little bit frustrated with how unhelpful custom function editor is and want to make it a little bit more helpful :slightly_smiling_face:
Making it a proper code editor would be a big task, but we can improve lives of people who using it by hardcoding common python packets and functions. So it will be something like that:

Do you think it would be useful?

This is a common theme in our feedback - developer personas frequently show us they use an external IDE and then paste their code back into AI Hub, especially if it’s a complex script. If it’s a quick and trivial change to make I think it’d be appreciated and wouldn’t hurt cc @Serena 

In this feature space, the big investment we’re currently designing is the ability to create shared, reusable functions so customers don’t need to rewrite and maintain the same code in dozens of places. This would be a strong candidate for development next quarter.

thanks for sharing your feedback! @demetr.starshov

1. i'm not sure what to include in a list of common python functions to add some hard-coded options for autocomplete
    a. i also wonder whether this may lead to more user confusion? for example, users may be confused why they see an autocomplete option for 1 string util but not another
2. as already mentioned, providing a proper code editor would be a big task
    a. we would need to run a language server in a backend service and connect the frontend with that language server (ex: https://github.com/TypeFox/monaco-languageclient)
this looks great!! i'll create an improvement ticket to track this so that after this is merged, the docs team will also know to update our docs
i thought it would take a long time to generate this list of autocompletion options - was AI helpful for generating this?
Yep, I just iterated on it to add everything I believe would be helpful and AI helped me to generate it
But maybe product people know what is missing there
:yupyupyup:  @Kaustubh (KD) @jack.robbins not urgent, but when you have time, could you look at the autocomplete options added in Demetr's PR?
